post.description: Enqueue a conversation to be processed asynchronously

ContentCreationConversationEnqueueReques.description: Represents a request to enqueue a conversation

userProfileId.description: A user profile ID; this will represent the profile that will receive the generated reply.

personaProfileId.description: A persona profile ID; this will represent the profile that our operator will impersonate.

language.description: The language used to generate the reply.

replyMode.description:
- Use `HUMAN` to receive a response written by a human.
- Use `AI` to receive a response generated by our AI model.

When using `AI`, the parameter `replyParameters.aiChatModel` must also be provided.

userProfileVersion.description: Specify the current user profile version. If it differs from the stored version, it will trigger a profile data refresh.

personaProfileVersion.description: Specify the current persona profile version. If it differs from the stored version, it will trigger a profile data refresh.

message.description: Enqueue a conversation with a message.

tags.description: A map of tags to associate with the generated answer. You can use any key-value pair to store additional information along with your request.

testMode.description:
Specify whether the conversation should be processed in test mode. In test mode, you will receive a dummy answer, which is useful for testing purposes.
> *You will not be charged* when using test mode.

replyParameters.description: A set of parameters that allow you to customize the reply you receive from us, enabling greater flexibility and control over the response format, content, and behavior.

date.description: The date when the message was sent.

type.description:
The type of the message.

| Type                         | Description                                                             |
|------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `TEXT`                       | User sent a text message to persona.                                    |
| `ACTION_FAVORITE_ADD`        | User profile added persona profile in its favorites.                    |
| `ACTION_FAVORITE_REMOVE`     | User profile removed persona profile in its favorites.                  |
| `ACTION_LIKE`                | User profile liked persona profile.                                     |
| `ACTION_PICTURE_REQUEST`     | User profile asked for persona profile's picture.                       |
| `ACTION_PICTURE_SHARE`       | User shared a picture.                                                  |
| `ACTION_PRIVATE_ALBUM_ALLOW` | User has granted access to their private album for the persona profile. |
| `ACTION_PRIVATE_ALBUM_DENY`  | User has denied access to their private album for the persona profile.  |

pictureUrl.description: The URL of the picture associated with the message. This parameter is optional and can be used to provide a picture to be displayed with the message.

text.description: The text of the message. This parameter is required when `type` is `TEXT`.

favorite.description:
Allows our operator to manage a persona profile's favorites:
- `PRESENT` indicates that the user is marked as a favorite, allowing the operator to remove them.
- `ABSENT` indicates that the user is not a favorite, allowing the operator to add them.
- If the value is `null` (default), this feature is disabled.

This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

privateAlbumAccess.description:
Allows our operator to manage a persona profileâ€™s private album access:
- `ALLOWED` means the user currently has access, allowing the operator to revoke it.
- `DENIED` means the user does not have access, allowing the operator to grant it.
- If the value is `null` (default), this feature is disabled.

This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

productType.description:
Defines how our operators will reply.
This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

aiMessageFrequency.description: Allows you to alternate between AI and human messages. For example, using the value 2, every other message will be an AI response.

allowedActions.description:
This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

| Name                    | Description                                                       |
|-------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `POKE`                  | User's has sent a 'poke' to the persona profile.                  |
| `PICTURE_REQUEST`       | User's has requested a picture to the persona profile.            |
| `PRIVATE_ALBUM_REQUEST` | User's has requested private album access to the persona profile. |

shareablePictures.description:
An array of shareable picture URLs that the operator can use.
This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

profileDistance.description: Distance between the persona profile and the user in kilometers or miles.

customInstructionName.description:
Custom instruction name to use for the reply. You can manage your custom instructions in your customer dashboard.
This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

emojis.description: Allows our operator/chat models to add emojis to the reply.

reportUserProfile.description:
Allows our operator to report the user profile, you will then receive `answer.created` webhook event with a type of `ACTION_REPORT_PROFILE_*`.
This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

conversationStoppable.description:
Allows our operator to stop the conversation (e.g. if the user starts being disrespectful).
This will only work in `HUMAN` reply mode.

aiChatModel.description: Allows you to set the AI chat model to use for generating the reply.

aiBufferSeconds.description: Allows you to set the AI buffer time (in seconds). This delay enables the AI to wait before generating a response, allowing it to accumulate more messages.

maxProcessingTimeSeconds.description:
Allows you to set the maximum processing time (in seconds) for a reply.
If this time limit is exceeded, the conversation will be dropped, and
you will receive an `answer.dropped` webhook event.

> **WARNING: This value may occasionally be exceeded by several seconds due to various factors.**

dropPolicy.description:
Allows you to set the reply drop policy. The default value is `DROP`.

| Policy Name   | Description                                                                                                                                         |
|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `DROP`        | Drop the conversation once the maximum processing time is reached.                                                                                  |
| `AI_FALLBACK` | If a conversation enqueued with HUMAN reply mode is not answered within the maximum processing time, it will automatically switch to AI reply mode. |
